thread.title: Canidium Appears in Inc. 5000 List for Third Consecutive Year
thread.title_full: Canidium Appears in Inc. 5000 List for Third Consecutive Year - PR.com

author: PR.com
title: Canidium Appears in Inc. 5000 List for Third Consecutive Year
text:
Canidium Appears in Inc. 5000 List for Third Consecutive Year
Houston, TX, August 25, 2015 --( PR.com )-- Canidium again has been recognized in the prestigious Inc. 5000 for 2015 in Inc. Magazine’s List of America’s Fastest Growing Private Companies. This marks Canidium’s third consecutive year of being recognized, ranking #3725 out of 5000 honorees.
Canidium is a Sales and Service Performance Management consulting firm which provides Strategy, Delivery and Managed Services as components of an integrated approach to help customers achieve their goals and objectives.
“Canidium is honored to be recognized in the Inc. 5000 again this year,” says Michael Stus, Founder and Managing Partner of Canidium. “Doing the right thing every day for our customers in the flourishing Sales and Service Performance Management industry has propelled our growth and success. Our appearance in the list, private and public funding flowing into the space, and analysts’ reports forecasting a healthy growing market indicate that we are providing highly needed services with tangible ROI.”
This is Inc. Magazine’s 34rd annual recognition of America’s fasting-growing privately-held companies. The full list of the Inc. 5000 can be seen at http://www.inc.com/inc5000/list/2015.
About Canidium
Canidium is the leading Sales and Service Performance and Incentive Compensation Management consultancy focused on using leading technologies to drive positive sales behaviors and increased ROI. We provide Strategy, Delivery and Managed Services as components of integrated approach to help our customers achieve their goals and objectives. Visit http://www.canidium.com or follow us on Twitter @canidium to learn more.
About Inc.
In 1982, Inc. Magazine introduced the Inc. 500, a list to showcase America’s fastest growing privately-held companies. Twenty-five years later, the list expanded to feature the top 5000 fastest growing privately-held companies in order to help readers get a deeper understanding of the entrepreneurial landscape. Companies on the Inc. 5000 will be featured in the magazine’s September issue. The complete list and company profiles can be found at http://www.inc.com/5000.
